p: There are few reports in the literature regarding cardiac arrhythmias in COVID-19, with no clear pathophysiological correlation. The potential mechanism seems to be viral myocarditis caused by SARS-CoV-2 [ 19]. Fulminant myocarditis associated with cardiogenic shock may be associated with the development of both ventricular and atrial arrhythmias, as myocardial inflammation itself with severe necrosis may develop re-entry points in the electrical circuit, evolving with ventricular tachycardia and ventricular fibrillation [ 22, 23].
